Package org.ejbca.core.ejb.ca.caadmin

Interface CAAdminSession

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CAAdminSessionLocal, CAAdminSessionRemote
    public interface CAAdminSession
    Administrates and manages CAs in EJBCA system.
    Version:
    $Id: CAAdminSession.java 30213 2018-10-26 10:09:06Z jekaterina_b_helmes $

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void activateCAService​(AuthenticationToken admin, int caid)
      Activates an 'Offline' CA Token and sets the CA status to active and ready for use again.
      byte[] createAuthCertSignRequest​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken, int caid, byte[] certSignRequest)
      If the CA can do so, this method signs another entity's CSR, for authentication.
      void createCA​(AuthenticationToken admin, CAInfo cainfo)
      Method used to create a new CA.
      void customLog​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken, String type, String caName, String username, String certificateSn, String msg, EventType event)
      Writes a custom audit log into the database.
      void deactivateCAService​(AuthenticationToken admin, int caid)
      Deactivates an 'active' CA token and sets the CA status to offline.
      void editCA​(AuthenticationToken admin, CAInfo cainfo)
      Method used to edit the data of a CA.
      boolean exitsPublisherInCAs​(int publisherid)
      Method used to check if publishers id exists in any CAs CRLPublishers Collection.

      Exports a CA to file.
      ExtendedCAServiceResponse extendedService​(AuthenticationToken admin, int caid, ExtendedCAServiceRequest request)
      Method used to perform a extended CA Service, like OCSP CA Service.
      void flushCACache()
      Makes sure that no CAs are cached to ensure that we read from database next time we try to access it.
      Collection<Certificate> getAllCACertificates()
      Method returning a Collection of Certificate of all CA certificates known to the system.
      Set<Integer> getAuthorizedPublisherIds​(AuthenticationToken admin)
      This method returns a set containing IDs of all authorized publishers.
      Set<Integer> getAuthorizedPublisherIds​(AuthenticationToken admin, List<Integer> excludedTypes)
      This method returns a set containing IDs of authorized publishers, except publishers of excluded types.
      List<String> getCAsUsingCertificateProfile​(int certificateprofileid)
      Method used to check if certificate profile id exists in any CA.

      Add an external CA's certificate as a CA.

      Method that is used to create a new CA from keys on an HSM and certificates in a file.

      Method that is used to create a new CA from an imported keystore from another type of CA, for example OpenSSL.

      Inits an external CA service.

      Unlike the similarly named method initializeAndUpgradeCAs(), this method initializes a previously uninitialized CA by setting its status to active and generating certificate chains for it.

      Creates a certificate request that should be sent to External CA for processing.

      Processes a Certificate Request from an external CA.

      Receives a certificate response from an external CA and sets the newly created CAs status to active.

      Removes the catoken keystore from the database and sets its status to CryptoToken.STATUS_OFFLINE.

      Updates all references to the given CAId/SubjectDN in the database.

    • Method Detail

      • makeRequest

        byte[] makeRequest​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                   int caid,
                   Collection<?> certChain,
                   String nextSignKeyAlias)
            throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                   CertPathValidatorException,
                   CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Creates a certificate request that should be sent to External CA for processing. This command will not affect the current issuing key or certificate.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - the administrator performing the action
        caid - id of the CA that should create the request
        certChain - A Collection of CA-certificates, can be either a collection of Certificate or byte[], or even empty collection or null.
        nextSignKeyAlias - The next key alias to use for this request. If null, then a new key pair will be generated named using the key sequence.
        Returns:
        request message in binary format, can be a PKCS10 or CVC request
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CertPathValidatorException - fail
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail

      • createAuthCertSignRequest

        byte[] createAuthCertSignRequest​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                 int caid,
                                 byte[] certSignRequest)
                          throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                 CADoesntExistsException,
                                 CryptoTokenOfflineException
        If the CA can do so, this method signs another entity's CSR, for authentication. Prime example of for EU EAC ePassports where the DVs initial certificate request is signed by the CVCA. The signature algorithm used to sign the request will be whatever algorithm the CA uses to sign certificates.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - token
        caid - the CA that should sign the request
        certSignRequest - binary certificate request, the format should be understood by the CA
        Returns:
        binary certificate request, which is the same as passed in except also signed by the CA, or it might be the exact same if the CA does not support request signing
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CADoesntExistsException - fail
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail

      • receiveResponse

        void receiveResponse​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                     int caid,
                     ResponseMessage responsemessage,
                     Collection<?> cachain,
                     String nextKeyAlias)
              throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                     CertPathValidatorException,
                     EjbcaException,
                     CesecoreException
        Receives a certificate response from an external CA and sets the newly created CAs status to active.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - The administrator performing the action
        caid - The caid (DN.hashCode()) of the CA that is receiving this response
        responsemessage - X509ResponseMessage with the certificate issued to this CA
        cachain - an optional collection with the CA certificate(s), or null. If given the complete chain (except this CAs own certificate must be given). The contents can be either Certificate objects, or byte[]'s with DER encoded certificates.
        nextKeyAlias - compare received certificate to this alias's public key
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - auth
        CertPathValidatorException - cert
        EjbcaException - fail
        CesecoreException - fail

      • receiveResponse

        void receiveResponse​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                     int caid,
                     ResponseMessage responsemessage,
                     Collection<?> cachain,
                     String nextKeyAlias,
                     boolean futureRollover)
              throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                     CertPathValidatorException,
                     EjbcaException,
                     CesecoreException
        Receives a certificate response from an external CA and sets the newly created CAs status to active.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - The administrator performing the action
        caid - The caid (DN.hashCode()) of the CA that is receiving this response
        responsemessage - X509ResponseMessage with the certificate issued to this CA
        cachain - an optional collection with the CA certificate(s), or null. If given the complete chain (except this CAs own certificate must be given). The contents can be either Certificate objects, or byte[]'s with DER encoded certificates.
        nextKeyAlias - compare received certificate to this alias's public key
        futureRollover - If the request is for a certificate that will have a validity start date in the future. Issued certificates will use the existing CA certificiate/key until it expires.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CertPathValidatorException - fail
        EjbcaException - fail
        CesecoreException - fail

      • processRequest

        ResponseMessage processRequest​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                               CAInfo cainfo,
                               RequestMessage requestmessage)
                        throws CAExistsException,
                               CADoesntExistsException,
                               AuthorizationDeniedException,
                               CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Processes a Certificate Request from an external CA.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        cainfo - the info for the CA that should be created, or already exists. Don't forget to set signedBy in the info.
        requestmessage - req
        Returns:
        response
        Throws:
        CAExistsException - fail
        CADoesntExistsException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail

      • importCACertificate

        void importCACertificate​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                         String caName,
                         Collection<CertificateWrapper> wrappedCerts)
                  throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                         CAExistsException,
                         IllegalCryptoTokenException,
                         CertificateImportException
        Add an external CA's certificate as a CA.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - auth
        caName - name
        wrappedCerts - contains the full certificate chain down to the leaf CA to be imported. Use EJBTools.wrapCertCollection(java.util.Collection<java.security.cert.Certificate>) to convert to the wrapper type.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CAExistsException - fail
        IllegalCryptoTokenException - fail
        CertificateImportException - in the case the certificate was already imported or the provided certificates could not be used.

      • updateCACertificate

        void updateCACertificate​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                         int caId,
                         Collection<CertificateWrapper> wrappedCerts)
                  throws CADoesntExistsException,
                         AuthorizationDeniedException,
                         CertificateImportException
        Update an existing external CA's certificate chain. We allow the same leaf CA certificate to be re-imported in the case where the chain has changed.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - auth
        caId - ca
        wrappedCerts - contains the full certificate chain down to the leaf CA to be imported. Use EJBTools.wrapCertCollection(java.util.Collection<java.security.cert.Certificate>) to convert to the wrapper type.
        Throws:
        CADoesntExistsException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CertificateImportException - in the case the certificate was already imported or the provided certificates could not be used.

      • initExternalCAService

        void initExternalCAService​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                           int caid,
                           ExtendedCAServiceInfo info)
                    throws CADoesntExistsException,
                           AuthorizationDeniedException,
                           CAOfflineException
        Inits an external CA service. this means that a new key and certificate will be generated for this service, if it exists before. If it does not exist before it will be created.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        caid - ca
        info - info
        Throws:
        CADoesntExistsException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CAOfflineException - fail

      • initializeCa

        void initializeCa​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                  CAInfo caInfo)
           throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                  CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                  InvalidAlgorithmException
        Unlike the similarly named method initializeAndUpgradeCAs(), this method initializes a previously uninitialized CA by setting its status to active and generating certificate chains for it.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - an authentication token
        caInfo - representing the CA
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if user was denied authorization to edit CAs
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the keystore defined by the cryptotoken in caInfo has no keys
        InvalidAlgorithmException - if the CA signature algorithm is invalid

      • renewCA

        void renewCA​(AuthenticationToken administrator,
             int caid,
             String nextSignKeyAlias,
             Date customNotBefore,
             boolean createLinkCertificate)
      throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
             CryptoTokenOfflineException,
             CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException
        Renews a existing CA certificate using the requested keys or by generating new keys. The specified notBefore date will be used. Other data about the new CA is taken from database. This method is used for renewing CAs internally in EJBCA. For renewing CAs signed by external CAs, makeRequest is used to generate a certificate request.
        Parameters:
        administrator - admin
        caid - the caid of the CA that will be renewed
        nextSignKeyAlias - The cryptoTokenAlias to use for the next keys or null to generate a new key pair using the CA key sequence.
        customNotBefore - date to use as notBefore date in the new certificate or null if not custom date should be used which means that the current time will be used (normal case).
        createLinkCertificate - generates an additional certificate stored in the CA object with the next keys signed by the current keys.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail
        CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException - fail

      • rolloverCA

        void rolloverCA​(AuthenticationToken administrator,
                int caid)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Replaces the certificate chain and key in a CA with the roll over chain and key. Intended to be called after a roll over chain/key, created with makeRequest(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken, int, java.util.Collection<?>, java.lang.String) with futureRollover=true, has became valid.
        Parameters:
        administrator - admin
        caid - The CAId of the CA.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail

      • renewCA

        void renewCA​(AuthenticationToken admin,
             int caid,
             boolean regenerateKeys,
             Date customNotBefore,
             boolean createLinkCertificate)
      throws CADoesntExistsException,
             AuthorizationDeniedException,
             CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Renews a existing CA certificate using the requested keys or by generating new keys. The specified notBefore date will be used. Other data about the new CA is taken from database. This method is used for renewing CAs internally in EJBCA. For renewing CAs signed by external CAs, makeRequest is used to generate a certificate request.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        caid - the caid of the CA that will be renewed
        regenerateKeys - if true and the CA have a soft CAToken the keys are regenerated before the certificate request.
        customNotBefore - date to use as notBefore date in the new certificate or null if not custom date should be used which means that the current time will be used (normal case).
        createLinkCertificate - generates an additional certificate stored in the CA object with the new keys signed by the current keys. For CVC CAs this is ignored and the link certificate is always generated.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if admin was not authorized to this CA
        CADoesntExistsException - if CA with ID caid didn't exist.
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail

      • renewCANewSubjectDn

        void renewCANewSubjectDn​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                         int caid,
                         boolean regenerateKeys,
                         Date customNotBefore,
                         boolean createLinkCertificate,
                         String newSubjectDN)
                  throws CADoesntExistsException,
                         AuthorizationDeniedException,
                         CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                         CANameChangeRenewalException
        Renews an existing CA certificate using the requested keys or by generating new keys. After renewal CA certificate will have new name (subjectDN) specified with newCAName. CA name change operation is not part of RFC 5280 and is introduced with ICAO 9303 7th edition. If generated, linked certificates will have IssuerDN of old-named and SubjectDN of new-named CA certificate and will be signed by old-named CA certificate. This operation is intended to be used with ICAO CSCA, although it should work with every X509 CA. This operation is not supported for CVC CA. The specified notBefore date and newCAName will be used. Other data about the new CA is taken from database. This method is used for renewing CAs internally in EJBCA. For renewing CAs signed by external CAs, makeRequest is used to generate a certificate request.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        caid - the caid of the CA that will be renewed
        regenerateKeys - if true and the CA have a soft CAToken the keys are regenerated before the certificate request.
        customNotBefore - date to use as notBefore date in the new certificate or null if not custom date should be used which means that the current time will be used (normal case).
        createLinkCertificate - generates an additional certificate stored in the CA object with the new keys signed by the current keys. For CVC CAs this is ignored and the link certificate is always generated.
        newSubjectDN - new SubjectDN/IssuerDN of CA certificate (new CA Name will be Common Name value)
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if admin was not authorized to this CA
        CADoesntExistsException - if CA with ID caid didn't exist.
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail
        CANameChangeRenewalException - if the specified newSubjectDN is not valid for some reason (same as the current one, does not contain the Common Name or CA Name already exists under this name)

      • renewCANewSubjectDn

        void renewCANewSubjectDn​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                         int caid,
                         String nextSignKeyAlias,
                         Date customNotBefore,
                         boolean createLinkCertificate,
                         String newSubjectDN)
                  throws CADoesntExistsException,
                         AuthorizationDeniedException,
                         CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                         CANameChangeRenewalException
        Renews an existing CA certificate using the requested keys or by generating new keys. After renewal CA certificate will have new name (subjectDN) specified with newCAName. CA name change operation is not part of RFC 5280 and is introduced with ICAO 9303 7th edition. If generated, linked certificates will have IssuerDN of old-named and SubjectDN of new-named CA certificate and will be signed by old-named CA certificate. This operation is intended to be used with ICAO CSCA, although it should work with every X509 CA. This operation is not supported for CVC CA. The specified notBefore date and newCAName will be used. Other data about the new CA is taken from database. This method is used for renewing CAs internally in EJBCA. For renewing CAs signed by external CAs, makeRequest is used to generate a certificate request.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        caid - the caid of the CA that will be renewed
        nextSignKeyAlias - The cryptoTokenAlias to use for the next keys or null to generate a new key pair using the CA key sequence.
        customNotBefore - date to use as notBefore date in the new certificate or null if not custom date should be used which means that the current time will be used (normal case).
        createLinkCertificate - generates an additional certificate stored in the CA object with the new keys signed by the current keys. For CVC CAs this is ignored and the link certificate is always generated.
        newSubjectDN - new SubjectDN/IssuerDN of CA certificate (new CA Name will be Common Name value)
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if admin was not authorized to this CA
        CADoesntExistsException - if CA with ID caid didn't exist.
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail
        CANameChangeRenewalException - if the specified newSubjectDN is not valid for some reason (same as the current one, does not contain the Common Name or CA Name already exists under this name)

      • revokeCA

        void revokeCA​(AuthenticationToken admin,
              int caid,
              int reason)
       throws CADoesntExistsException,
              AuthorizationDeniedException
        Method that revokes the CA. After this is all certificates created by this CA revoked and a final CRL is created.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator requesting the revocation
        caid - the ID of the CA
        reason - one of RevokedCertInfo.REVOCATION_REASON values.
        Throws:
        CADoesntExistsException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • importCAFromKeyStore

        void importCAFromKeyStore​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                          String caname,
                          byte[] p12file,
                          String keystorepass,
                          String privkeypass,
                          String privateSignatureKeyAlias,
                          String privateEncryptionKeyAlias)
        Method that is used to create a new CA from an imported keystore from another type of CA, for example OpenSSL.
        Parameters:
        admin - Administrator
        caname - the CA-name (human readable) the newly created CA will get
        p12file - a byte array of old server p12 file.
        keystorepass - used to unlock the keystore.
        privkeypass - used to unlock the private key.
        privateSignatureKeyAlias - the alias for the private key in the keystore.
        privateEncryptionKeyAlias - the alias for the private encryption key in the keystore

      • importCAFromKeys

        void importCAFromKeys​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                      String caname,
                      String keystorepass,
                      Certificate[] signatureCertChain,
                      PublicKey p12PublicSignatureKey,
                      PrivateKey p12PrivateSignatureKey,
                      PrivateKey p12PrivateEncryptionKey,
                      PublicKey p12PublicEncryptionKey)
               throws CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException,
                      CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                      IllegalCryptoTokenException,
                      CAExistsException,
                      AuthorizationDeniedException,
                      CAOfflineException
        Method that is used to create a new CA from keys and certificates.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        caname - The name the new CA will have
        keystorepass - The keystore password the CA will have
        signatureCertChain - The CA certificate(s)
        p12PublicSignatureKey - CA public signature key
        p12PrivateSignatureKey - CA private signature key
        p12PrivateEncryptionKey - CA private encryption key, or null to generate a new encryption key
        p12PublicEncryptionKey - CA public encryption key, or null to generate a new encryption key
        Throws:
        CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException - fail
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail
        IllegalCryptoTokenException - fail
        CAExistsException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CAOfflineException - if CRLs can not be generated because imported CA did not manage to get online

      • importCAFromHSM

        void importCAFromHSM​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                     String caname,
                     Certificate[] signatureCertChain,
                     String catokenpassword,
                     String catokenclasspath,
                     String catokenproperties)
              throws CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                     CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException,
                     IllegalCryptoTokenException,
                     CAExistsException,
                     AuthorizationDeniedException,
                     CAOfflineException,
                     NoSuchSlotException
        Method that is used to create a new CA from keys on an HSM and certificates in a file.
        Parameters:
        admin - Administrator
        caname - the CA-name (human readable) the newly created CA will get
        signatureCertChain - chain of certificates, this CAs certificate first.
        catokenpassword - used to unlock the HSM keys.
        catokenclasspath - classpath to one of the HardToken classes, for example org.cesecore.keys.token.PKCS11CryptoToken.
        catokenproperties - the catoken properties, same as usually entered in the adminGUI for hard token CAs.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if imported CA was signed by a CA user does not have authorization to.
        CAExistsException - if the CA already exists
        CAOfflineException - if CRLs can not be generated because imported CA did not manage to get online
        CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException - if authentication to the crypto token failed.
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if crypto token is unavailable.
        NoSuchSlotException - if no slot as defined by the label in catokenproperties could be found
        IllegalCryptoTokenException - the certificate chain is incomplete

      • exportCAKeyStore

        byte[] exportCAKeyStore​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                        String caname,
                        String keystorepass,
                        String privkeypass,
                        String privateSignatureKeyAlias,
                        String privateEncryptionKeyAlias)
        Exports a CA to file. The method only works for soft tokens.
        Parameters:
        admin - Administrator
        caname - the CA-name (human readable) the CA
        keystorepass - used to lock the keystore.
        privkeypass - used to lock the private key.
        privateSignatureKeyAlias - the alias for the private signature key in the keystore.
        privateEncryptionKeyAlias - the alias for the private encryption key in teh keystore
        Returns:
        A byte array of the CAs p12 in case of X509 CA and pkcs8 private certificate signing key in case of CVC CA.

      • getAllCACertificates

        Collection<Certificate> getAllCACertificates()
        Method returning a Collection of Certificate of all CA certificates known to the system. Certificates for External CAs or CAs that are awaiting certificate response are not returned, because we don't have certificates for them. Uses getAvailableCAs to list CAs.
        Returns:
        certs

      • activateCAService

        void activateCAService​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                       int caid)
                throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                       ApprovalException,
                       WaitingForApprovalException,
                       CADoesntExistsException
        Activates an 'Offline' CA Token and sets the CA status to active and ready for use again. The admin must be authorized to "/ca_functionality/basic_functions/activate_ca" in order to activate/deactivate.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator calling the method
        caid - the is of the CA to activate
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - it the administrator isn't authorized to activate the CA.
        ApprovalException - if an approval already is waiting for specified action
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action have been added in the approval queue.
        CADoesntExistsException - fail

      • deactivateCAService

        void deactivateCAService​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                         int caid)
                  throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                         CADoesntExistsException
        Deactivates an 'active' CA token and sets the CA status to offline. The admin must be authorized to "/ca_functionality/basic_functions/activate_ca" in order to activate/deactivate.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator calling the method
        caid - the is of the CA to activate.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - it the administrator isn't authorized to activate the CA.
        CADoesntExistsException - if the given caid couldn't be found or its status is wrong.

      • removeCAKeyStore

        void removeCAKeyStore​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                      String caname)
               throws javax.ejb.EJBException
        Removes the catoken keystore from the database and sets its status to CryptoToken.STATUS_OFFLINE. The signature algorithm, encryption algorithm, key algorithm and other properties are not removed so that the keystore can later by restored by using restoreCAKeyStore(AuthenticationToken, String, byte[], String, String, String, String) .
        Parameters:
        admin - Administrator
        caname - Name (human readable) of CA for which the keystore should be removed
        Throws:
        javax.ejb.EJBException - in case if the catoken is not a soft catoken
        See Also:
        exportCAKeyStore(AuthenticationToken, String, String, String, String, String)

      • restoreCAKeyStore

        void restoreCAKeyStore​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                       String caname,
                       byte[] p12file,
                       String keystorepass,
                       String privkeypass,
                       String privateSignatureKeyAlias,
                       String privateEncryptionKeyAlias)
                throws javax.ejb.EJBException
        Restores the keys for the CAToken from a KeyStore.
        Parameters:
        admin - Administrator
        caname - Name (human readable) of the CA for which the keystore should be restored
        p12file - The KeyStore to read keys from
        keystorepass - Password for the KeyStore
        privkeypass - Password for the private key
        privateSignatureKeyAlias - Alias of the signature key in the KeyStore
        privateEncryptionKeyAlias - Alias of the encryption key in the KeyStore
        Throws:
        javax.ejb.EJBException - in case of the CAToken is not a soft CAToken or if the CA already has an active CAToken or if any of the aliases can not be found or if the KeyStore does not contain the right private key

      • editCA

        void editCA​(AuthenticationToken admin,
            CAInfo cainfo)
     throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Method used to edit the data of a CA. Not all of the CAs data can be edited after the creation, therefore will only the values from CAInfo that is possible be updated. But if the CA is in uninitialized state then the Subject DN (and CA ID) may in fact be changed, which is not possible otherwise.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        cainfo - CAInfo object containing values that will be updated see org.ejbca.core.model.ca.caadmin.CAInfo see org.ejbca.core.model.ca.caadmin.X509CAInfo
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • getCAsUsingCertificateProfile

        List<String> getCAsUsingCertificateProfile​(int certificateprofileid)
        Method used to check if certificate profile id exists in any CA.
        Parameters:
        certificateprofileid - the ID of the sought certificate profile
        Returns:
        a list of names of the CAs using the certificate profile

      • exitsPublisherInCAs

        boolean exitsPublisherInCAs​(int publisherid)
        Method used to check if publishers id exists in any CAs CRLPublishers Collection.
        Parameters:
        publisherid - ID
        Returns:
        fail

      • publishCACertificate

        void publishCACertificate​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                          Collection<Certificate> certificatechain,
                          Collection<Integer> usedpublishers,
                          String caDataDN)
                   throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Method that publishes the given CA certificate chain to the list of publishers. Is mainly used when CA is created.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator performing the event.
        certificatechain - Certificate chain to publish
        usedpublishers - a collection if publisher id's (Integer) indicating which publisher that should be used.
        caDataDN - DN from CA data. If a the CA certificate does not have a DN object to be used by the publisher this DN could be searched for the object.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • publishCRL

        void publishCRL​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                Certificate caCert,
                Collection<Integer> usedpublishers,
                String caDataDN,
                boolean doPublishDeltaCRL)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        (Re-)Publish the last CRLs for a CA.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator performing the event.
        caCert - The certificate for the CA to publish CRLs for
        usedpublishers - a collection if publisher id's (Integer) indicating which publisher that should be used.
        caDataDN - DN from CA data. If a the CA certificate does not have a DN object to be used by the publisher this DN could be searched for the object.
        doPublishDeltaCRL - should delta CRLs be published?
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • getAuthorizedPublisherIds

        Set<Integer> getAuthorizedPublisherIds​(AuthenticationToken admin)
        This method returns a set containing IDs of all authorized publishers. This set will be the sum of the following: * Unassigned publishers * Publishers assigned to CAs that the admin has access to * Publishers assigned to Certificate Profiles that the admin has access to * Publishers assigned to Peers (if Enterprise mode) that the admin has access to
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        Returns:
        a Set of IDs of authorized publishers.

      • getAuthorizedPublisherIds

        Set<Integer> getAuthorizedPublisherIds​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                       List<Integer> excludedTypes)
        This method returns a set containing IDs of authorized publishers, except publishers of excluded types. This set will be the sum of the following: * Unassigned publishers * Publishers assigned to CAs that the admin has access to * Publishers assigned to Certificate Profiles that the admin has access to * Publishers assigned to Peers (if Enterprise mode) that the admin has access to
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        excludedTypes - types
        Returns:
        a Set of IDs of authorized publishers.

      • createCA

        void createCA​(AuthenticationToken admin,
              CAInfo cainfo)
       throws CAExistsException,
              AuthorizationDeniedException,
              CryptoTokenOfflineException,
              InvalidAlgorithmException
        Method used to create a new CA. The cainfo parameter should at least contain the following information. SubjectDN Name (if null then is subjectDN used). Description (optional) Status (SecConst.CA_ACTIVE or SecConst.CA_WAITING_CERTIFICATE_RESPONSE) SignedBy (CAInfo.SELFSIGNED, CAInfo.SIGNEDBYEXTERNALCA or CAId of internal CA)
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        cainfo - ca
        Throws:
        CAExistsException - if CA defined by cainfo already exists.
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if crypto token was not available.
        InvalidAlgorithmException - if the CA signature algorithm is invalid For other optional values see: see org.ejbca.core.model.ca.caadmin.CAInfo see org.ejbca.core.model.ca.caadmin.X509CAInfo

      • extendedService

        ExtendedCAServiceResponse extendedService​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                          int caid,
                                          ExtendedCAServiceRequest request)
                                   throws ExtendedCAServiceRequestException,
                                          IllegalExtendedCAServiceRequestException,
                                          ExtendedCAServiceNotActiveException,
                                          CADoesntExistsException,
                                          AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                          CertificateEncodingException,
                                          CertificateException,
                                          org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException
        Method used to perform a extended CA Service, like OCSP CA Service.
        Parameters:
        admin - Information about the administrator or admin performing the event.
        caid - the CA that should perform the service
        request - a service request.
        Returns:
        A corresponding response.
        Throws:
        ExtendedCAServiceRequestException - fail
        IllegalExtendedCAServiceRequestException - if the request was invalid.
        ExtendedCAServiceNotActiveException - thrown when the service for the given CA isn't activated
        CADoesntExistsException - The given caid does not exist.
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException - fail
        CertificateException - fail
        CertificateEncodingException - fail

      • flushCACache

        void flushCACache()
        Makes sure that no CAs are cached to ensure that we read from database next time we try to access it. Present in remote interface so we can call it from CLI.

      • getLatestLinkCertificate

        byte[] getLatestLinkCertificate​(int caId)
                         throws CADoesntExistsException
        Parameters:
        caId - ID
        Returns:
        the latest link certificate (if any)
        Throws:
        CADoesntExistsException - CA

      • updateCAIds

        void updateCAIds​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                 int fromId,
                 int toId,
                 String toDN)
          throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Updates all references to the given CAId/SubjectDN in the database. This method must be called when the Subject DN of a CA is changed.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Authentication token
        fromId - CA Id to change from.
        toId - CA Id to change to.
        toDN - Subject DN to change to.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • customLog

        void customLog​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
               String type,
               String caName,
               String username,
               String certificateSn,
               String msg,
               EventType event)
        throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
               CADoesntExistsException
        Writes a custom audit log into the database. Authorization requirements: 
         - /administrator
 - /secureaudit/log_custom_events (must be configured in advanced mode when editing access rules)
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - the authentication token.
        type - a user defined string used as a prefix in the log comment.
        caName - the name of the CA related to the event or null for the administrators CA to be used.
        username - the name of the related user or null if no related user exists.
        certificateSn - the certificates SN related to the log event or null if no certificate is related to this log event.
        msg - the message data used in the log comment. The log comment will have a syntax of 'type : msg'.
        event - the event type (log level) of the log entry (EjbcaEventTypes).
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the administrators isn't authorized to log.
        CADoesntExistsException - if a referenced CA does not exist.
